meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4.1.0.CR2 released!
meta.summary: The second candidate release of the upcoming Vert.x 4.1 has just been released. We consider it feature complete and invite the community to test it.

content.renderedOutput:
We are ex­tremely pleased to an­nounce the sec­ond can­di­date re­lease of Vert.x 4.1.

Vert.x 4.1 comes with a set of new ex­cit­ing fea­tures!

Dep­re­ca­tions and break­ing changes can be found on the wiki.

The 4.1 re­lease notes can be found on the wiki.

For this re­lease, there are no Docker im­ages.

The re­lease ar­ti­facts have been de­ployed to Maven Cen­tral and you can get the dis­tri­b­u­tion on Maven Cen­tral.

You can boot­strap a Vert.x 4.1.0.CR2 project using https://start.vertx.io.

The doc­u­men­ta­tion has been de­ployed on the web-​site: https://vertx.io/docs/4.1.0

That’s it! Happy cod­ing and see you soon on our user or dev chan­nels.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4.1.0 released!
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x version 4.1.0 has just been released. It comes with a set of new exciting features!

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4.1.0.CR1 released!
meta.summary: The first candidate release of the upcoming Vert.x 4.1 has just been released. We consider it feature complete and invite the community to test it.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4 CR2 released!
meta.summary: The second release candidate of the upcoming Vert.x 4 has just been released. We consider it feature complete and invite the community to test it.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4 CR1 released!
meta.summary: The first release candidate of the upcoming Vert.x 4 has just been released. We consider it feature complete and invite the community to test it.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.
